intro: Phanera kockiana var. velutina, commonly known as the velvety phanera, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
